tool_description: Embedded Finance API for automated invoicing, supporting accounts payable, accounts receivable, payments and cash flow management.
name: Monite
title: Monite

api_list.description: Starts the approval process once the uploaded payable is validated.

import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/entity_users"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: cancel_payable_payables__payable_id__cancel_post
api_list.description: Cancels the payable that was not confirmed during the review.

api_list.name: upload_new_payable_payables_post
api_list.description: Uploads an incoming invoice (payable) in PDF, PNG, JPG, or GIF format. The max file size is 10MB.

api_list.name: mark_payable_as_paid_payables__payable_id__mark_as_paid_post
api_list.description: Converts the specified payable status into paid.

api_list.name: upload_payable_with_data_payables_upload_with_data_post
api_list.description:
Add a new payable by providing the amount, currency, vendor name, and other details
along with the original document (`base64_encoded_file`).
The original document is required for the reference. Any file formats are allowed.

You can use this endpoint to bypass the Monite OCR service and provide the data directly
(for example, if you already have the data in place).

A newly created payable has the the `draft` [status](https://docs.monite.com/docs/payables-lifecycle).
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/payables/upload_with_data"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: create_new_entity_entities_post
api_list.description:
Creates a new entity.
    An entity is a representation of the partner's customers and can be either an Organization
    (including freelancers) or an Individual (person).
    Monite automatically applies to the entity the financial regulations of the country designated
    in the `country` parameter.
    A partner-level token is required for this action.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/entities"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: obtain_new_token_auth__entity_user_id__post
api_list.description:
Create an authentication token used by an Entity for further API calls.

    The Entity token in the return parameters gives the Entity
    rights to create, customise, and configure the business logic for a specific Entity.

api_list.name: obtain_new_token_entities__entity_id__access_post
api_list.description:
Retrieves an authentication token for this Entity only.
    The token gives access to the secure Monite space that stores data for this Entity.
    You use this token to access the Entity API and update the business logic for this Entity.

api_list.name: create_tag_tags_post
api_list.description:
Create a new tag for use in payables. The tag name must be unique.
    Tag names are case-sensitive, that is `Marketing` and `marketing` are two different tags.


The response returns an auto-generated ID assigned to this tag.
To assign this tag to a payable, send the tag ID in the `tag_ids` list when creating or updating a payable.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/tags"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: reject_payable_payables__payable_id__reject_post
api_list.description: Declines the payable when an approver finds any mismatch or discrepancies.

api_list.name: add_settings_me_init_settings_post
api_list.description:
Set the size of the preview icon that represents an entity user.
    The `width` and `height` attributes in the payload are measured in pixels.

An entity user is a person who works for an entity.
An entity is a company or an individual that is a client of an API Partner.
An API Partner is a company that integrates Monite into their app or platform.
Each entity has a secured Monite space that is managed by the API Partner.
Each API Partner manages one or more entities in Monite.

Calls to this endpoint update the size of the preview icon for all entities managed by an API Partner.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/me/init_settings"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: create_domain_mailbox_domains_post
api_list.description:
For an Entity, associate an email domain with a workflow.

    An email domain is the web address that comes after `@` in an email address. You use domains to make your
    workflows easily understandable for each Entity and their customers. For example, you create the
    `payables.<entity name>.com` domain for payables, and `accounts-receivable.<entity name>.com` for,
    you guessed it, accounts receivable.

    When you create an email domain, you configure the Monite workflow associated with the mailbox. For example,
    you associate `payables.<entity name>.com` with the `payables` Monite object.

    You do not have to use Monite domains to manage your workflows. Use `partner-api/entities/v1/mailboxes/mailbox`
    to connect a specific workflow to an email address.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/mailbox_domains"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: obtain_new_token_auth_post
api_list.description:
Log in to Monite and create an authentication token used by this API Partner for further API calls.

API Partners who successfully login retrieve an admin token in the return parameters. This gives the API Partner
rights to create, customise and configure settings for each Entity they develop software for. The API Partner
cannot trigger any business logic for an Entity.

        }

schema.title: CounterpartResponse

anyOf.title: CounterpartIndividualResponse

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Date and time when the counterpart was created. Timestamps follow the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

updated_at.title: Updated At
updated_at.description: Date and time when the counterpart was last updated. Timestamps follow the [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard.

type.description: The counterpart type: `organization` (juridical person) or `individual` (natural person).

created_automatically.title: Created Automatically
created_automatically.description: `true` if the counterpart was created automatically by Monite when processing incoming invoices with OCR. `false` if the counterpart was created by the API client.

individual.title: CounterpartIndividual

title.title: Title
title.description: The person's title or honorific. Examples: Mr., Ms., Dr., Prof.

is_vendor.title: Is Vendor
is_vendor.description: Indicates if the counterpart is a vendor.

is_customer.title: Is Customer
is_customer.description: Indicates if the counterpart is a customer.

individual.description: Represents counterparts that are individuals (natural persons).

anyOf.description: Represents counterparts that are individuals (natural persons).

schema.description:
A Counterpart object contains information about an organization (juridical person) or
individual (natural person) that provides goods and services to or buys them from an
[SME](https://monite.stoplight.io/docs/api-docs/ZG9jOjQyMDM0NzMx-glossary#sme).

api_list.name: create_new_workflow_workflows_post
api_list.description: Create new workflow
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/workflows"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: create_mailbox_mailboxes_post
api_list.description:
For an Entity, associate a mailbox with a workflow.

    An mailbox is the web address that comes before `@` in an email address. You use mailboxes to make your
    workflows easily understandable for each Entity and their customers. For example, you create the
    `payables@<entity name>.com` domain for payables, and `accounts-receivable@<entity name>.com` for,
    you guessed it, accounts receivable.

    When you create a mailbox, you configure the Monite workflow associated with the mailbox. For example,
    you associate `payables.<entity name>.com` with the `payables` Monite object.

    You do not have to link a workflow to a single mailbox. Use `/partner-api/api_users/v1/mailboxes/domain`
    to connect a specific workflow to a domain. This way you associate multiple email addresses to a workflow
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://monite2.p.rapidapi.com/mailboxes"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "monite2.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.post(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
